item.description:
The Oak Room is a grand old restaurant in the Copley Square Fairmont Hotel. The dining room is stunningly beautiful, with a high ornately carved ceiling and fixtures -- see picture. The food is excellent too.

But cheap it is not. Expect to drop $60-70 not including drinks. Also, the web site says "No Shorts, Hats, Cut-Out/Tank-Top T-Shirts, or Sport Sandals", but I would say: dress nicely.

Check out the menu at:

http://theoakroom.com...

I'm going to the Arthur Frommer lecture at the nearby Boston Public Library beforehand (6pm). (That is free.) You are welcome to join me for that. I just used his guide book in Budapest and am curious what he has to say.

- Harold
item.how_to_find_us: Ask the host or look for the group
item.name: Oak Room
